newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Cyprus Exchange approves automation contract.
newsitem.headline: Cyprus Exchange approves automation contract.

text.p: The Cyprus Stock Exchange has endorsed a 430,000-pound automation contract from Financial Market Software Consultants of Australia, the exchange announced.
The contract is to set up a clearance system to create a central depository system and computerise trading. The procedure will be complete by the first half of 1998.
Automation will be a "decisive factor" in the further development of the stock market, a statement from the exchange said.
"With the completion of this procedure the CSE will be aligned fully with international standards and practices followed in developed stock markets," it said.
The cost of the contract includes computers and software programmes, it added.
The Cyprus Stock Exchange started operating in an official capacity in March, after years of over-the-counter unofficial transactions supervised by the Cyprus Chamber of Commerce and Industry.
